text:
Synopsis
The FDIC engaged in systematic efforts to discourage banks from offering crypto services, potentially undermining the crypto industry through regulatory pressure and attempting to hide these actions from public scrutiny.

Key Insights
- Coinbase obtained FOIA (Freedom of Information Act) requests that revealed the FDIC was instructing banks to avoid crypto banking products
- A judge overturned FDIC's objections to document unredaction, exposing the agency's attempts to hide communications
- An anonymous whistleblower (FDIC Exposed) claimed FDIC leadership systematically investigated crypto critics and intentionally mislabeled records
- The FDIC appears to have violated core regulatory principles by acting with a "vendetta" against the crypto industry
- There are suggestions of potential leadership changes or investigations into the FDIC's actions under a potential new administration
- The incident highlights growing distrust in regulatory agencies and their handling of the crypto sector
